content.title: 3つの郡に発行された天気予報 -  JOE.ie
content.desc: Will this weather never cease? Following weather warnings aplenty during the week, three more counties are to be on the defensive against some awful weather this weekend. On Saturday morning, Met ireann issued a status yellow weather warning for wind in Clare, Cork and Kerry. The alert has warned the public in that area that "West to northwest winds will reach mean speeds of 55 to 60 km/h with gusts 90 to 110 km/h in Kerry and in the west of Cork and Clare." The warning is set to be in effect for 12 hours, between 6pm on Saturday evening (8 November) and 6am on Sunday morning. A similar gal...

content.title: MetÉireannは、この2つの郡に対してオレンジ色の気象警報を発しました。
content.desc: Two counties are included in the latest weather warning from Met ireann. The Status Orange warning relates to Donegal and Cavan coming into effect at 1 am tonight. Areas of high ground and coastal regions in the aforementioned counties are likely to experience extreme winds and there is a risk of coastal damage. The warning from the national forecaster reads: "This warning pertains to coastal regions and high ground in these areas: Southwest winds will reach mean speeds of 65 to 80km/h with gusts of 110 to 130km/h overnight and early tomorrow. There is also a risk of coastal damage on expos...

content.title: 地方自治体は、ストーム・ダイアナのためにカントリー・ブレースとして「厳しい天気のチーム」を活性化するように指示した -  Independent.ie
content.desc: Local authorities across the country have tonight been told to activate their “severe weather teams” as Storm Diana moves in. A period of disturbed weather is now predicted to continue for five days Officials say Storm Diana’s impact will be felt over the next 48 hours as it track upwards from the Azores. The National Directorate for Fire & Emergency Management have contacted all local authorities, requesting that they activate their crisis management arrangements where necessary. A spokesperson for Housing Minister Eoghan Murphy said his department has contacted transport officials request...

content.title: メリー・エーレンは、木曜日に降雨の警告が鳴り響いて、起こりうる「嵐の状態」を警告している。TheJournal.ie
content.desc: MET ÉIREANN HAS said that possible stormy conditions could hit the country later this week, as a Status Yellow rainfall warning comes into effect today. The rainfall warning applies to Counties Wexford, Cork and Waterford and began at 3pm today and is set to last until tomorrow at noon. Up to 30mm of rainfall is expected in places with locally higher accumulations in upland and coastal areas. Met Éireann said this will lead to spot flooding. Following on from this, the weather will be more settled for Wednesday, before becoming more unsettled on Thursday evening. “Rain becoming widespread o...
